Description: A fragrant rice dish cooked with vegetables and spices.
ingredients_list: 1 cup of basmati rice, 2 cups of water, 2 tablespoons of oil or ghee, 1 bay leaf, 2-3 cloves, 2-3 green cardamoms, 1 small cinnamon stick, 1 teaspoon cumin seeds, 1 medium onion (thinly sliced), 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste, 1 green chili (optional), 1 cup of mixed vegetables like carrots, beans, peas, and potatoes (diced), ½ teaspoon turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon garam masala, salt to taste, and fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
Procedure: Rinse and soak basmati rice for 20 minutes. Sauté spices, onions, and ginger-garlic paste in oil. Add mixed vegetables, turmeric, garam masala, and salt; cook briefly. Mix in drained rice, add water, and simmer covered for 15-20 minutes until rice is fluffy. Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

Description: Crispy dosa topped with caramelized onions.
ingredients_list: Dosa Batter, 2 Onions, Salt, 2-3 Green chillies,few Coriander leaves,1 spoon Cumin seeds,Ghee or Oil
Procedure: Heat a tawa and spread dosa batter thinly. Sprinkle chopped onions, green chilies, coriander, and cumin seeds on top. Drizzle oil around the edges and cook on medium heat until crispy. Fold and serve hot with chutney or sambhar.

Description: Spicy chutney powder made with lentils and spices.
ingredients_list: 1 cup of chana dal, ½ cup of urad dal, 10-15 dried red chilies, ¼ cup of sesame seeds, a small piece of tamarind, a few curry leaves, ½ teaspoon of asafoetida, ½ teaspoon of salt, and 1-2 teaspoons of jaggery.
Procedure: Dry roast 1 cup of chana dal, ½ cup of urad dal, and 10-15 dried red chilies until aromatic. Roast ¼ cup sesame seeds, a small piece of tamarind, and a few curry leaves separately. Cool, then grind everything with ½ teaspoon asafoetida, ½ teaspoon salt, and 1-2 teaspoons jaggery into a coarse powder. Store in an airtight container and enjoy with dosa, idli, or rice.

Description: Soft steamed idlis served with crispy vadas.
ingredients_list: For idli, you'll need 2 cups of rice, 1 cup of urad dal, 1 teaspoon of fenugreek seeds, and salt to taste. For medu vada, you'll need 1 cup of urad dal, 1-2 green chilies, a few curry leaves, a pinch of asafoetida, salt, and oil for frying.
Procedure: For idli, soak rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds, grind into a batter, ferment overnight, and steam in idli molds. For medu vada, soak urad dal, grind into a thick batter, mix with chilies, curry leaves, and asafoetida, shape into vadas, and deep-fry until golden.

Description: A traditional South Indian dessert often made during festivals and celebrations
ingredients_list: ½ cup rice, ¼ cup moong dal, ¾ cup jaggery, 2 tablespoons ghee, 2-3 cardamom pods, 8-10 cashews, 8-10 raisins, and a pinch of edible camphor (optional).
Procedure: Cook rice and moong dal together in a pressure cooker until soft. Melt jaggery in water, strain, and mix it with the cooked rice-dal mixture. Simmer for a few minutes, then add cardamom powder, ghee, fried cashews, and raisins. Stir well and serve warm.

Description: A savory, spiced rice and moong dal dish, often served for breakfast or as a snack.
ingredients_list: ½ cup rice, ¼ cup moong dal, 1 tablespoon ghee, 1 teaspoon black pepper, 1 teaspoon cumin seeds, 1-2 green chilies, a few curry leaves, a pinch of asafoetida, 8-10 cashews, and salt to taste.
Procedure: Roast rice and moong dal together, then cook with water until soft. In a pan, heat ghee, fry cumin seeds, black pepper, chilies, curry leaves, and cashews. Mix the tempering with the cooked rice-dal, add salt, and cook for a few minutes. Serve hot.

Description: A savory, spiced semolina dish, typically served for breakfast.
ingredients_list: 1 cup semolina (rava), 1 tablespoon ghee or oil, 1 teaspoon mustard seeds, 1 teaspoon urad dal, 1-2 green chilies, a few curry leaves, 1 onion (finely chopped), 1 cup water, and salt to taste.
Procedure: Heat ghee or oil, temper mustard seeds, urad dal, chilies, and curry leaves. Add onions and vegetables, saute until soft. Add water and salt, bring it to a boil, then slowly stir in semolina. Cook until the water is absorbed, and the mixture is thick. Serve hot.

Description: A gluten-free, nutritious flatbread made from sorghum flour.
ingredients_list: 1 cup jowar flour, warm water, a pinch of salt, and ghee or oil for cooking.
Procedure: Mix jowar flour and salt, gradually add warm water, and knead into a soft dough. Divide into balls, roll out into flat discs, and cook on a hot tawa, flipping and applying ghee until both sides are golden brown. Serve hot.

Description: A light, healthy, and flavorful rice flake dish, perfect for breakfast.
ingredients_list: 1 cup flattened rice (poha), 1 tablespoon oil, 1 teaspoon mustard seeds, 1-2 green chilies, a few curry leaves, 1 onion (finely chopped), ½ teaspoon turmeric powder, 1 tablespoon peanuts, and salt to taste.
Procedure: Rinse poha and set aside. Heat oil, temper mustard seeds, chilies, curry leaves, and peanuts. Add chopped onions and sauté until soft, then add turmeric and salt. Mix in the poha and cook for 2-3 minutes. Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

Description: A flavorful, tangy lentil stew with vegetables, often served with rice or dosas.
ingredients_list: 1 cup toor dal, 1-2 tomatoes, 1 onion, mixed vegetables (carrot, beans, potato), 1 tablespoon sambar powder, 1 teaspoon mustard seeds, a few curry leaves, 1-2 dried red chilies, tamarind, and salt to taste.
Procedure: Cook toor dal and vegetables until soft. In a pan, temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, dried chilies, and add onions and tomatoes. Add tamarind extract, sambar powder, and the cooked dal-vegetable mix. Simmer for a few minutes and serve hot.

Description: A tangy, spicy soup, often served with rice.
ingredients_list: 1 cup tamarind pulp, 1 tablespoon rasam powder, 1 tomato, 1 teaspoon mustard seeds, 1-2 dried red chilies, a few curry leaves, 1-2 garlic cloves, a pinch of asafoetida, and salt to taste.
Procedure: Boil tamarind pulp, rasam powder, and chopped tomatoes until soft. In a pan, temper mustard seeds, dried chilies, garlic, and curry leaves. Add the tempered mixture to the tamarind soup, bring to a boil, and simmer for a few minutes. Serve hot with rice.

Description: Flavorful curry served with deep-fried poori bread.
ingredients_list: 2-3 medium potatoes, 1 onion, 1 tomato, 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste, 1 tablespoon sambar powder, ½ teaspoon turmeric powder, 1-2 green chilies, a few curry leaves, 1 teaspoon mustard seeds, and salt to taste.
Procedure: Boil potatoes and mash them. In a pan, heat oil and temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Add onions, sauté until soft, then add tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. Add mashed potatoes, water, and simmer until the gravy thickens. Serve with poori.

Description: A a spicy, tangy chicken dish
ingredients_list: 500g boneless chicken, 2 tablespoons rice flour, 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste, 1 tablespoon red chili powder, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 onion, 1 bell pepper, 2-3 green chilies, 1 tablespoon vinegar, curry leaves, and oil
Procedure: Marinate chicken with ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, soy sauce, and salt. Fry chicken pieces until crispy. In a pan, sauté onions, bell peppers, and green chilies. Add fried chicken, curry leaves, vinegar, and toss well. Cook for a few minutes until the sauce thickens. Serve hot

Description: A spicy, aromatic South Indian curry.
ingredients_list: 00g chicken, 2 onions, 2 tomatoes, 2 tablespoons Chettinad masala, 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste, curry leaves, 1 teaspoon mustard seeds, 2-3 dried red chilies, ½ cup coconut milk, and oil
Procedure: Saute onions, curry leaves, mustard seeds, and chilies. Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and Chettinad masala. Add chicken, cook until tender, and finish with coconut milk. Simmer until the gravy thickens and serve hot.

ingredients_list: 1 cup basmati rice, 1 tablespoon ghee or oil, 1 teaspoon cumin seeds, 2-3 cloves, 1 bay leaf, 1 cinnamon stick, and salt
Procedure: Cook basmati rice and set aside. In a pan, heat ghee, temper cumin seeds, cloves, bay leaf, and cinnamon. Add cooked rice, mix well, and season with salt. Serve hot.

ingredients_list: 500g chicken, 2 tablespoons cornflour, 1 tablespoon rice flour, 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste, 1 tablespoon red chili powder, curry leaves, 1 egg, and oil
Procedure: Marinate chicken with spices, ginger-garlic paste, egg, and flours. Deep-fry until golden and garnish with fried curry leaves. Serve hot.

ingredients_list: 500g chicken, 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste, 1 tablespoon yogurt, 1 tablespoon garam masala, 1 teaspoon chili powder, lemon juice, and skewers.
Procedure: Marinate chicken with spices and yogurt. Skewer the pieces and grill or roast until charred and cooked. Serve with chutney.

ingredients_list: Potatoes, oil for frying, and salt.
Procedure: Peel and cut potatoes into sticks, soak in cold water, and pat dry. Fry twice: first at low heat, then at high heat until golden. Sprinkle with salt and serve.

ingredients_list: Gram flour (besan), sugar, ghee, and water.
Procedure: Cook sugar syrup to one-string consistency. Add gram flour and stir in hot ghee until the mixture thickens. Pour into a greased tray and cut when set.

ingredients_list: Semolina(Rava), sugar, ghee, saffron, water, and cardamom.
Procedure: Roast semolina in ghee, add boiling water and saffron. Stir in sugar and cardamom, cook until thick, and serve warm.

ingredients_list: Cooked rice, tamarind paste, sesame seeds, dried red chilies, curry leaves, mustard seeds, peanuts, turmeric, jaggery, oil, salt, and spices like coriander, fenugreek, and asafoetida.
Procedure: Prepare the tamarind sauce by boiling tamarind paste with jaggery, turmeric, and ground roasted spices. Temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, and dried chilies in hot oil, then add peanuts and the tamarind mixture. Mix this tangy sauce with cooked rice, ensuring its evenly coated. Serve warm.

ingredients_list: Cooked rice, lemon juice, green chilies, curry leaves, mustard seeds, turmeric, ginger, peanuts or cashews, oil, and salt.
Procedure: Heat oil and temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, and ginger. Add turmeric and roasted peanuts or cashews. Mix in cooked rice, pour fresh lemon juice, and stir well for an even coating. Serve warm or at room temperature.

ingredients_list: Cooked rice, curd (yogurt), milk, green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, mustard seeds, asafoetida, coriander leaves, pomegranate seeds (optional), and salt.
Procedure: Mash cooked rice and mix with curd, milk, and salt for a creamy consistency. Temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies in oil, then pour over the rice. Garnish with chopped coriander and pomegranate seeds if desired. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

ingredients_list: Basmati rice, ghee, sliced onions, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, whole spices (cinnamon, cloves, bay leaf, cardamom), cashews, raisins, water, and salt.
Procedure: Heat ghee, fry whole spices, onions, cashews, and raisins until golden. Add rinsed rice, sauté briefly, then cook with water and salt until fluffy. Serve hot with a side of curry or raita.

ingredients_list: Rice, urad dal, fenugreek seeds (for batter), boiled potatoes, onions, green chilies, curry leaves, mustard seeds, turmeric, ginger, oil, salt, and water.
Procedure: Ferment dosa batter overnight. Prepare the potato masala by tempering spices and mixing them with mashed potatoes. Spread batter thinly on a hot griddle, cook until crispy, add filling, and fold. Serve with chutney and sambar.

ingredients_list: Rice, toor dal (pigeon peas), tamarind, bisibelebath powder (spice mix), vegetables (carrots, beans, peas), ghee, mustard seeds, curry leaves, dried red chilies, asafoetida, jaggery, and cashews.
Procedure: Cook rice and dal separately. Boil chopped vegetables with tamarind water and bisibelebath powder. Mix cooked rice, dal, and vegetable mixture, then simmer. Temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, and chilies in ghee, pour over the rice, and garnish with cashews. Serve hot with papad or raita.

ingredients_list: Ground coffee (preferably filter coffee blend), water, milk, sugar.
Procedure: Boil water and pour it into a traditional South Indian filter. Add the ground coffee into the top compartment and let it drip slowly through the filter overnight. The coffee concentrate (decoction) will collect in the bottom container. To serve, mix the decoction with hot milk and sugar to taste, then stir well. Serve in a traditional steel tumbler and davara (small cup).

ingredients_list: Cooked rice, mixed vegetables (carrot, peas, beans, bell peppers), onions, garlic, soy sauce, green chilies, sesame oil, spring onions, and salt.
Procedure: Heat sesame oil in a pan, sauté onions, garlic, and green chilies until fragrant. Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender. Add cooked rice and soy sauce, then stir-fry everything together on high heat until well combined. Garnish with spring onions and serve hot.

ingredients_list: Eggs, salt, pepper, onions, tomatoes, green chilies, herbs (like coriander or parsley), and oil or butter.
Procedure: Whisk eggs with salt, pepper, and chopped vegetables. Heat oil or butter in a pan, pour in the egg mixture, and cook on medium heat. Once the edges set, fold the omelette in half and cook until fully set. Serve hot with bread or toast.

ingredients_list: Grated fresh coconut, green chilies, ginger, roasted chana dal (gram dal), curry leaves, mustard seeds, tamarind (or lemon juice), salt, and oil.
Procedure: Grind the grated coconut, green chilies, ginger, and roasted chana dal with a little water to a smooth paste. Add tamarind or lemon juice and salt, then mix well. For tempering, heat oil, and fry mustard seeds and curry leaves, then pour over the chutney. Serve with dosa, idli, or vada.

ingredients_list: Peanuts, dried red chilies, garlic, tamarind, salt, oil, mustard seeds, curry leaves.
Procedure: Roast the peanuts until golden and set aside. In the same pan, roast dried red chilies and garlic. Grind the peanuts, chilies, garlic, tamarind, and salt into a smooth paste, adding water as needed. For tempering, heat oil, add mustard seeds, and curry leaves, then pour over the chutney. Serve with dosa, idli, or rice.

ingredients_list: Cooked rice, mixed vegetables (carrot, beans, peas), green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, coriander, coconut, spices (cloves, cinnamon, bay leaf), turmeric, garam masala or rice bath powder, ghee or oil, and salt.
Procedure: Sauté spices in ghee or oil, add vegetables, green chilies, and ginger, and cook until tender. Mix in turmeric, garam masala, and a paste of coconut and coriander. Add cooked rice, stir gently to coat, and cook briefly. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with raita or pickle.

ingredients_list: Jeera samba rice (or basmati), chicken or mutton, onion, tomatoes, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, curd, mint leaves, coriander leaves, biryani masala, whole spices (bay leaf, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom), turmeric, red chili powder, oil, and ghee.
Procedure: Sauté whole spices in oil and ghee, then add onions, green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste. Cook until fragrant, then add meat, tomatoes, spices, curd, and herbs. Simmer until the meat is tender. Add washed rice, water, and salt, then cook until rice is fluffy and well-infused with flavors. Serve hot with raita and boiled eggs.

ingredients_list: Semolina (rava), curd, water, baking soda or Eno, mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, ginger, coriander leaves, grated carrots, and salt.
Procedure: Dry roast semolina until aromatic. Mix with curd, water, and salt to form a thick batter. Add grated carrots and chopped coriander. Temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, and chilies in oil, and mix into the batter. Just before steaming, add baking soda or Eno. Pour the batter into greased idli molds and steam for 10-12 minutes. Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

ingredients_list: Ripe bananas, jaggery (or sugar), coconut milk, cardamom powder, and a pinch of salt.
Procedure: Peel and slice bananas into a bowl. Dissolve jaggery in coconut milk and mix well, adding a pinch of cardamom powder and salt for flavor. Pour the sweetened coconut milk over the banana slices and stir gently. Serve fresh as a dessert or snack.

ingredients_list: Bread slices, butter, mayonnaise or green chutney, sliced vegetables (cucumber, tomato, onion, capsicum), salt, pepper, and optional cheese slices.
Procedure: Spread butter and mayonnaise or chutney on bread slices. Layer sliced vegetables evenly, sprinkle salt and pepper, and add cheese if desired. Cover with another bread slice, press gently, and toast or serve fresh. Pair with ketchup or any dip of your choice.

ingredients_list: Bread slices, butter, cheese slices or grated cheese, fresh tomato slices, oregano or Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Procedure: Butter the bread slices, place a layer of tomato slices, and sprinkle with salt, pepper, and oregano. Add a cheese slice or grated cheese, then cover with another bread slice. Toast or grill until golden and the cheese melts. Serve hot with ketchup or any dip.

ingredients_list: Cooked rice, ripe tomatoes, green chilies, onion, ginger-garlic paste, curry leaves, mustard seeds, turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, coriander leaves, oil, ghee, and salt.
Procedure: Heat oil and ghee, temper mustard seeds and curry leaves, and sauté onions and green chilies. Add ginger-garlic paste, chopped tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until tomatoes are soft and the mixture thickens. Mix in cooked rice and stir gently. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with raita or papad.

ingredients_list: Vermicelli (seviyan), milk, sugar, ghee, cardamom powder, chopped nuts (almonds, cashews, pistachios), raisins, and saffron (optional).
Procedure: Roast vermicelli in ghee until golden. Boil milk, add roasted vermicelli, and cook until soft. Stir in sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron. Add chopped nuts and raisins, simmer until creamy. Serve warm or chilled as a dessert.

ingredients_list: Roasted vermicelli, mixed vegetables (carrot, beans, peas), green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, mustard seeds, turmeric, lemon juice, coriander leaves, oil, and salt.
Procedure: Cook vermicelli in boiling water until soft, then drain and set aside. Heat oil, temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Add vegetables and turmeric, sauté until tender. Mix in the cooked vermicelli, salt, and lemon juice. Stir gently, garnish with coriander leaves, and serve hot with chutney or pickle.

ingredients_list: Raw rice, grated coconut, water, and salt.
Procedure: Soak rice for a few hours, then grind with coconut and water into a smooth, thin batter. Add salt and adjust consistency to resemble thin buttermilk. Pour a ladleful onto a hot, greased pan, swirling to form a lacy crepe. Cook until edges lift, then serve hot with coconut chutney, sambar, or jaggery mixed with coconut.

ingredients_list: Ragi flour, whole wheat flour, water, salt, oil, and optional spices (cumin or carom seeds).
Procedure: Mix ragi flour, wheat flour, salt, and spices, then add water gradually to form a soft dough. Divide into small balls and roll out into thin circles using a little dry flour. Cook each roti on a hot tawa, drizzling oil on both sides until golden brown and cooked through. Serve with curry or chutney.

ingredients_list: Eggs, onions, tomatoes, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin seeds, curry leaves, oil, salt, and coriander leaves.
Procedure: Heat oil in a pan, temper cumin seeds and curry leaves. Add chopped onions, green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste, and sauté until onions soften. Add tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, and coriander powder, cooking until the tomatoes are soft. Beat eggs and pour them into the pan, stirring continuously until scrambled and cooked. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with bread or roti.

ingredients_list: Cooked rice, eggs, onions, green chilies, garlic, soy sauce, peas, carrots, spring onions, oil, salt, and pepper.
Procedure: Heat oil in a pan, scramble the eggs and set aside. In the same pan, sauté chopped onions, garlic, and green chilies. Add peas and carrots, and cook until tender. Stir in the cooked rice, soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Add scrambled eggs and mix well. Garnish with spring onions and serve hot.

Description: Steamed rice dumplings filled with coconut.
ingredients_list: Rice flour, grated coconut, jaggery, cardamom powder, water, salt.
Procedure: Prepare the filling by mixing grated coconut, jaggery, and cardamom powder in a pan. Cook until the jaggery melts and the mixture thickens, then set aside. Make a dough by boiling water with a pinch of salt and mixing it with rice flour until smooth. Shape the dough into small balls, flatten them, and place a spoonful of the coconut filling in the center. Fold and seal the edges to form a dumpling. Steam the kadabu for 10-15 minutes. Serve hot.

ingredients_list: Grated carrots, milk, sugar, ghee, cardamom powder, chopped nuts (cashews, almonds), and raisins.
Procedure: Cook grated carrots in ghee until softened. Add milk and simmer until the mixture thickens. Stir in sugar and cardamom powder, continuing to cook until the halwa reaches a pudding-like consistency. Fry the chopped nuts and raisins in ghee and mix them into the halwa. Serve warm or chilled as a dessert.

ingredients_list: Ragi flour, water, jaggery (or sugar), ghee, cardamom powder, and salt.
Procedure: Heat ghee in a pan, add ragi flour, and roast until aromatic. In another pan, dissolve jaggery in water and bring it to a boil. Add the jaggery syrup to the roasted ragi flour, and stir to combine. Add cardamom powder and a pinch of salt. Once the mixture cools slightly, shape it into small balls. Let them cool completely before serving.

ingredients_list: Country chicken (nati koli), onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, curry leaves, coconut, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, turmeric, red chili powder, mustard seeds, oil, and salt.
Procedure: Marinate the chicken with turmeric, salt, and ginger-garlic paste. Heat oil in a pot, temper mustard seeds, and add curry leaves, chopped onions, and green chilies. Sauté until onions are golden, then add tomatoes and cook until soft. Add coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, and garam masala, and cook the spices until fragrant. Add marinated chicken, cook for a few minutes, then add water and cook until the chicken is tender. Grind fresh coconut and add it to the curry for richness. Simmer and serve hot with rice or roti.

ingredients_list: Mutton chops, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, yogurt, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, mint leaves, oil, salt.
Procedure: Marinate the mutton chops with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt for at least 1-2 hours. Heat oil in a pan, sauté onions, green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste until golden. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft, then add coriander powder, garam masala, and mint leaves. Add the marinated chops and sear them on all sides. Pour water and cook until the chops are tender and the gravy thickens. Serve hot with naan or rice.

ingredients_list: Cooked rice, sweet corn kernels, onions, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, cumin seeds, coriander leaves, lemon juice, oil, and salt.
Procedure: Heat oil in a pan, temper cumin seeds, and sauté onions, green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste until golden. Add sweet corn kernels and cook for a few minutes. Add turmeric, salt, and the cooked rice, mixing gently to combine. Stir in lemon juice and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with raita or pickle.

ingredients_list: Ripe tomatoes, onions, garlic, carrots, celery, vegetable broth or water, butter or oil, salt, pepper, sugar, and fresh herbs (basil or parsley).
Procedure: Sauté chopped onions, garlic, carrots, and celery in butter or oil until softened. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they release their juice. Pour in the broth or water and simmer for 20 minutes. Blend the mixture until smooth, then return to the heat, adding salt, pepper, and a pinch of sugar to balance the acidity. Garnish with fresh herbs and serve hot.

ingredients_list: Chicken (boneless, cut into pieces), yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, butter, onions, tomatoes, cream, kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves), salt, and oil.
Procedure: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt for at least 1-2 hours. Heat butter and oil in a pan, sauté onions until golden, and add ginger-garlic paste. Add chopped tomatoes, cook until soft, then blend into a smooth puree. In the same pan, add marinated chicken and cook until tender. Add the tomato puree, garam masala, kasuri methi, and cream. Simmer until the gravy thickens. Serve hot with naan or rice.

ingredients_list: Paneer (cottage cheese), butter, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, cream, garam masala, red chili powder, turmeric, kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves), sugar, salt, and oil.
Procedure: Sauté chopped onions in butter until golden, then add ginger-garlic paste and cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, turmeric, and salt, and cook until the tomatoes soften. Blend the mixture into a smooth puree. In the same pan, heat butter, add the puree, and cook for a few minutes. Add garam masala, kasuri methi, and cream, and simmer for a rich gravy. Add paneer cubes and cook gently until the paneer absorbs the flavors. Serve hot with naan or rice.

ingredients_list: Whole black lentils (sabut urad dal), kidney beans (rajma), onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, butter, cream, cumin seeds, garam masala, red chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, salt, and oil.
Procedure: Soak black lentils and kidney beans overnight, then pressure cook until soft. In a pan, heat oil and butter, sauté cumin seeds, onions, and ginger-garlic paste until golden. Add tomatoes, red chili powder, turmeric, and coriander powder, and cook until the tomatoes soften. Add the cooked dal and rajma along with some water, simmer for a while to blend the flavors. Stir in garam masala, butter, and cream, and cook until the dal reaches a creamy consistency. Serve hot with naan or rice.

ingredients_list: Kidney beans (rajma), onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, cumin seeds, garam masala, coriander powder, turmeric, red chili powder, oil, salt, and fresh coriander leaves.
Procedure: Soak the kidney beans overnight, then pressure cook until soft. Heat oil in a pan, temper cumin seeds, and sauté onions and green chilies until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until fragrant, then add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook the mixture until the tomatoes soften and oil separates. Add the cooked rajma and some water, and simmer to blend the flavors. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve with rice or roti.

ingredients_list: For Chole: Chickpeas (chole), onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, cumin seeds, garam masala, coriander powder, turmeric, red chili powder, amchur, and salt.For Bature: All-purpose flour (maida), semolina (sooji), yogurt, sugar, salt, baking powder, and oil.
Procedure: Soak and cook chickpeas until soft. Prepare a spice blend with onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and spices, then simmer the chickpeas in this mixture. For bature, make a dough from flour, semolina, yogurt, and baking powder. Roll out, fry until puffed, and serve hot with the spicy chickpea curry.

ingredients_list: For the filling: Potatoes, onions, green chilies, ginger, coriander leaves, garam masala, cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt. For the dough: Whole wheat flour, water, salt, and oil.
Procedure: Boil and mash the potatoes. Mix with chopped onions, green chilies, ginger, coriander leaves, and spices to form the filling. Prepare the dough by kneading flour, salt, and water into a smooth consistency. Divide the dough into balls, roll out a small circle, place the filling in the center, seal it, and roll it out again into a flatbread. Cook the paratha on a hot griddle, applying ghee or oil on both sides until golden brown. Serve hot with yogurt, pickle, or raita.

ingredients_list: For the puris: Semolina (rava), all-purpose flour (maida), baking soda, and oil for frying. For the pani: Tamarind, mint leaves, coriander, green chilies, roasted cumin powder, black salt, and water. For the filling: Boiled potatoes, chickpeas, onions, and salt.
Procedure: Make a dough with semolina, maida, and water; deep fry small puris. Blend mint, tamarind, and spices to prepare the pani. Fill the puris with boiled potato and chickpea mixture, dip into the spicy pani, and serve immediately.

ingredients_list: Paneer (cubed), yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, lemon juice, oil, salt, and skewers.
Procedure: Marinate paneer cubes in a mixture of yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices, lemon juice, and salt for at least 1-2 hours. Thread the marinated paneer onto skewers and grill or bake until slightly charred and cooked through. Serve hot with chutney and salad.

Description: Spicy vegetable mash with buttered bread.
ingredients_list: For Bhaji: Mixed vegetables (potatoes, peas, carrots, cauliflower), onions, tomatoes, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, pav bhaji masala, red chili powder, turmeric, butter, and salt. For Pav: Pav buns, butter.
Procedure: Boil and mash the vegetables. Heat butter, sauté onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste. Add spices and the mashed vegetables, cook together until flavors blend. For pav, butter and toast the buns. Serve the bhaji with the buttered pav and garnish with chopped onions, cilantro, and a squeeze of lemon.

ingredients_list: For the filling: Potatoes, onions, green peas, green chilies, ginger, garam masala, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt.For the dough: All-purpose flour (maida), carom seeds, salt, and oil for frying.Prepare the filling by cooking boiled potatoes with sautéed onions, peas, and spices. Make the dough by mixing flour, carom seeds, and salt, then knead into a smooth dough. Roll into circles, stuff with the filling, fold into a triangle shape, and seal the edges. Deep fry until golden and crispy.
Procedure: Prepare the filling by cooking boiled potatoes with sautéed onions, peas, and spices. Make the dough by mixing flour, carom seeds, and salt, then knead into a smooth dough. Roll into circles, stuff with the filling, fold into a triangle shape, and seal the edges. Deep fry until golden and crispy.

ingredients_list: For the filling: Moong dal (yellow split lentils), onions, green chilies, ginger, garam masala, cumin powder, coriander powder, fennel seeds, and salt.For the dough: All-purpose flour (maida), semolina (sooji), carom seeds (ajwain), salt, and oil for frying.
Procedure: Soak moong dal for a few hours, then cook it with spices like cumin powder, garam masala, and salt until dry and thick. Make a dough by mixing flour, semolina, carom seeds, salt, and oil. Roll the dough into small discs, place the filling in the center, and seal them into a ball. Deep fry the kachoris until golden and crispy. Serve hot with chutney.

ingredients_list: Bhindi (okra), onions, tomatoes, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, cumin seeds, turmeric, coriander powder, garam masala, red chili powder, amchur (dry mango powder), salt, and oil.
Procedure: Heat oil in a pan, sauté cumin seeds, onions, and green chilies until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until fragrant. Stir in chopped tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt, cooking until the tomatoes soften. Add the sliced bhindi and cook on medium heat, stirring occasionally, until tender. Sprinkle garam masala and amchur, mix well, and serve hot with roti or rice

ingredients_list: Spinach (palak), paneer (cottage cheese), onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, cumin seeds, turmeric, garam masala, cream, salt, and oil.
Procedure: Blanch the spinach and blend it into a smooth puree. Heat oil in a pan, sauté cumin seeds, onions, and green chilies until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until fragrant, then add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Stir in turmeric, garam masala, and salt. Add the spinach puree and simmer. Add paneer cubes and cook for a few minutes. Stir in cream for a rich texture and serve hot with roti or rice.

ingredients_list: Potatoes, cauliflower, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, cumin seeds, turmeric, coriander powder, garam masala, red chili powder, cumin powder, salt, and oil.
Procedure: Heat oil in a pan, sauté cumin seeds, onions, and green chilies until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until fragrant, then add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Stir in turmeric, coriander powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, and salt. Add cubed potatoes and cauliflower florets, mix well, and cook covered on low heat until tender. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with roti or rice.

Description: Grilled, spiced chicken with smoky flavor.
ingredients_list: Chicken (preferably with skin), yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, lemon juice, mustard oil, cumin powder, coriander powder, salt, and fresh coriander leaves.
Procedure: Make deep slashes in the chicken to allow the marinade to penetrate. Mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, and all the spices to make a thick marinade. Coat the chicken thoroughly with the marinade and refrigerate for 4-6 hours or overnight. Preheat the grill or oven and cook the chicken until it's tender and slightly charred, basting with oil or butter occasionally. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or rice.

Description: Tender mutton in a flavorful, spiced gravy.
ingredients_list: Mutton (goat meat), onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, yogurt, garam masala, Kashmiri red chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, cumin powder, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, bay leaves, and oil.
Procedure: Heat oil in a pot and sauté whole spices like cinnamon, cardamom, and cloves until fragrant. Add finely chopped onions and cook until golden brown. Stir in ginger-garlic paste, followed by tomatoes, and cook until soft. Add the mutton pieces and brown them. Mix in yogurt, Kashmiri red chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, cumin powder, and garam masala. Add water and simmer until the mutton becomes tender and the gravy thickens. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with naan or rice.

Description: Fragrant rice and spiced meat layers.
ingredients_list: For the rice: Basmati rice, bay leaves, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, saffron (optional), and salt.For the meat: Chicken or mutton, yogurt, onions, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, coriander, mint leaves, garam masala, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt.For the gravy: Tomatoes, fried onions, and ghee or oil.
Procedure: Marinate the chicken or mutton with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, mint, coriander, and spices for a few hours. Cook the rice with whole spices like bay leaves, cardamom, cinnamon, and cloves, until 70% cooked. In a large pot, layer the marinated meat, then top with partially cooked rice. Add fried onions, saffron-soaked milk (optional), and ghee. Cook on low heat (dum) until the meat is tender and the rice is fully cooked. Serve with raita or salad.

ingredients_list: For the dough: Milk powder, all-purpose flour (maida), baking soda, ghee, milk, and cardamom powder.For the syrup: Sugar, water, cardamom, rose water (optional), and saffron (optional).
Procedure: Make the dough by mixing milk powder, flour, baking soda, ghee, and milk to form a smooth consistency. Roll into small balls, ensuring no cracks. Heat oil in a pan, and fry the dough balls on low heat until golden brown and cooked through. For the syrup, boil sugar and water with cardamom, adding rose water and saffron for flavor. Once the gulab jamuns are fried, soak them in the warm syrup for a few hours. Serve hot or at room temperature.

ingredients_list: For the batter: All-purpose flour (maida), cornstarch, yogurt, baking soda, turmeric (for color), and water.For the syrup: Sugar, water, cardamom, saffron (optional), and rose water (optional).For frying: Ghee or oil.
Procedure: Mix the flour, cornstarch, yogurt, baking soda, turmeric, and water to form a smooth batter. Let it rest for 1-2 hours. Heat ghee or oil in a pan. Fill a piping bag or squeeze bottle with the batter and shape it into spiral patterns in the hot oil. Fry until crispy and golden. For the syrup, dissolve sugar in water, add cardamom, and boil until slightly thickened. Once fried, dip the jalebis in the warm syrup for a few seconds. Serve hot.

ingredients_list: All-purpose flour, semolina, sugar, milk, cardamom, and ghee for frying. Optional ingredients include coconut and fennel seeds.
Procedure: Mix flour, semolina, sugar, cardamom, and milk into a smooth batter. Heat ghee in a pan and pour spoonfuls of the batter to form small pancakes. Fry until golden and crisp. Optionally, soak in sugar syrup before serving.

ingredients_list: All-purpose flour, cabbage, carrots, onions, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, and spices. Salt and oil for dough and filling.
Procedure: Prepare the dough by mixing flour, salt, and water. For the filling, sauté finely chopped vegetables with garlic, ginger, and soy sauce. Roll out the dough, place the filling, and fold into dumplings. Steam for 10-15 minutes until cooked.

ingredients_list: Fresh chhena (cottage cheese), sugar, water, cardamom, and rose water (optional).
Procedure: Prepare chhena by draining curdled milk. Knead it into a smooth dough, then shape it into small balls. Boil sugar and water to make a syrup, then add cardamom. Drop the chhena balls into the syrup and cook for about 20 minutes until they double in size. Let them cool before serving.

ingredients_list: Yogurt, water, sugar, salt (for savory lassi), ice cubes, and cardamom (optional).
Procedure: Blend yogurt, water, and sugar (or salt) until smooth. Add ice cubes and cardamom for extra flavor. Blend again and serve chilled.

ingredients_list: Boiled potatoes, breadcrumbs, cornflour, cumin, coriander, garam masala, chili powder, salt, and oil for frying.
Procedure: Mash boiled potatoes and mix with spices, breadcrumbs, and cornflour. Shape into small patties. Heat oil in a pan and fry the patties until golden and crispy on both sides. Serve with chutney.

ingredients_list: Eggplant (baingan), onions, tomatoes, garlic, ginger, green chilies, cumin, coriander powder, turmeric, garam masala, oil, and cilantro for garnish.
Procedure: Roast the eggplant over an open flame or in the oven until soft. Peel off the skin and mash the flesh. Sauté onions, garlic, ginger, and tomatoes with spices. Add the mashed eggplant and cook for a few minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve with roti or rice.

ingredients_list: Rice, milk, sugar, cardamom, almonds, cashews, saffron (optional), and ghee.
Procedure: Wash and cook rice in milk until soft. Add sugar and cook until thickened. Stir in cardamom and ghee. Garnish with roasted nuts and saffron, if using. Serve warm or chilled.

ingredients_list: All-purpose flour, yeast, sugar, yogurt, baking powder, salt, ghee, and water.
Procedure: Mix flour, yeast, sugar, yogurt, and water to form a dough. Let it rise for an hour. Divide into small balls and roll into flat discs. Cook on a hot tawa or in a tandoor, brushing with ghee. Serve warm with curry or chutney.

ingredients_list: Besan (gram flour), water, cumin, turmeric, chili powder, salt, ginger, onions, tomatoes, cilantro, and oil for cooking.
Procedure: Mix besan with water, spices, and chopped vegetables to make a smooth batter. Heat oil in a pan, pour a portion of the batter, and spread it into a thin circle. Cook until both sides are golden and crisp. Serve with chutney or yogurt.

ingredients_list: All-purpose flour, yeast, sugar, salt, yogurt, milk, ghee, and water.
Procedure: Prepare a dough by mixing flour, yeast, sugar, salt, yogurt, and water. Let it rise for 1-2 hours. Roll the dough into flat discs and cook on a hot tawa or in a tandoor. Brush with melted ghee or butter after cooking. Serve warm with curries.

ingredients_list: Boiled potatoes, wheat flour, green chilies, ginger, turmeric, spices (cumin, coriander), oil, and salt.
Procedure: Prepare a spiced potato curry. Make a dough with wheat flour, roll into puris, and deep fry until golden. Serve with aloo curry.

ingredients_list: Gram flour (besan), yogurt, water, turmeric, Eno fruit salt, green chilies, ginger, mustard seeds, curry leaves, sugar, lemon juice, and coriander.
Procedure: Mix gram flour, yogurt, and spices into a batter, add Eno, steam until set, and temper with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and sugar syrup. Serve warm.

Description: A spicy, aromatic, flavourful paneer dish
ingredients_list: Paneer, bell peppers, onions, tomatoes, garlic, ginger, red chili powder, coriander seeds, garam masala, kasuri methi, and oil.
Procedure: Saute onions and bell peppers. Make a spiced tomato-based gravy, add paneer cubes, and cook until flavors combine. Garnish with kasuri methi and serve hot.

ingredients_list: Cauliflower florets, cornflour, all-purpose flour, ginger, garlic, soy sauce, chili sauce, ketchup, spring onions, and oil.
Procedure: Coat cauliflower in a spiced batter, deep fry until crispy. Sauté garlic and sauces, toss in fried florets, and garnish with spring onions. Serve hot.

ingredients_list: Mushrooms, black pepper, garlic, green chilies, onions, curry leaves, soy sauce, cornflour, and oil.
Procedure: Saute garlic, chilies, and curry leaves. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Sprinkle black pepper, soy sauce, and cornflour slurry. Toss well and serve hot.

ingredients_list: Mushrooms, onions, garlic, butter, milk, cream, black pepper, all-purpose flour, and salt.
Procedure: Saute garlic, onions, and mushrooms in butter. Blend half to make a puree. Add flour, milk, and puree. Simmer, season with salt and pepper, garnish with cream, and serve hot.

ingredients_list: Gram flour (besan), whole wheat flour, chopped onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, carom seeds (ajwain), salt, and water.
Procedure: Mix gram flour, wheat flour, onions, chilies, and spices. Knead into a soft dough. Roll into flat discs and cook on a hot tawa with oil until golden brown. Serve hot with curd or pickle.

ingredients_list: Basmati rice, mixed herbs (like parsley, thyme, or basil),oregano,chilli flakes, garlic, olive oil, butter, salt, and black pepper.
Procedure: Cook rice until fluffy. Sauté minced garlic in butter and olive oil, then add chopped herbs. Toss the cooked rice with the garlic-herb mixture, season with oregano,chilli flakes, salt and pepper, and serve warm.

ingredients_list: Maggi noodles, Maggi tastemaker, mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans, capsicum), onion, tomato, green chilies, garlic, oil, water, and  spices like chili powder,coriander powder, garam masala.
Procedure: Sauté chopped garlic, onion, and green chilies in oil. Add diced vegetables and cook until tender. Stir in the Maggi tastemaker and spices like chilli powder,coriander powder,garam masala. Pour water, bring to a boil, and add noodles. Cook until noodles are soft and water is absorbed. Serve hot!

ingredients_list: Vegetables (like banana peppers, potatoes, or eggplant), gram flour, rice flour, chili powder, turmeric, salt, and oil.
Procedure: Slice vegetables, dip in spiced gram flour batter, and deep-fry until golden and crispy. Serve hot.

ingredients_list: Boiled potatoes, gram flour, rice flour, green chilies, curry leaves, mustard seeds, turmeric, and oil.
Procedure: Make a spiced potato filling. Dip in gram flour batter, deep-fry until golden, and serve hot.

ingredients_list: Paneer cubes, cornflour, soy sauce, honey, chili sauce, bell peppers, sesame seeds, garlic, and oil.
Procedure: Coat paneer with cornflour, fry until crisp. Stir-fry garlic, bell peppers, add sauces, honey, fried paneer, and sesame seeds. Toss well and serve hot.

ingredients_list: Semolina (rava), rice flour, all-purpose flour, green chilies, cumin seeds, ginger, coriander, curry leaves, and water.
Procedure: Mix all ingredients into a thin batter. Pour onto a hot pan, cook until crispy, and serve hot with chutney or sambar.

ingredients_list: Puffed rice, sev, chopped onions, tomatoes, boiled potatoes, tamarind chutney, green chutney, coriander, and spices like chaat masala.
Procedure: Mix puffed rice with veggies, chutneys, and spices. Toss well, garnish with sev and coriander, and serve immediately.

ingredients_list: Dosa batter, chopped onions, green chilies, coriander, curry leaves, and oil for cooking.
Procedure: Mix onions, chilies, and coriander into dosa batter. Pour into a paddu pan, cook on both sides until golden, and serve hot with chutney.

ingredients_list: Rice, moong dal, ghee, cumin seeds, turmeric, green chilies, ginger, and vegetables like carrots and peas.
Procedure: Cook rice and moong dal with vegetables, spices, and water until soft. Add ghee, mix well, and serve warm.

ingredients_list: Oats, mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans), green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, mustard seeds, turmeric, and spices like garam masala.
Procedure: Saute spices and vegetables, add oats and water, cook until soft and flavorful. Serve hot.

ingredients_list: Ragi flour, water, milk (optional), jaggery or sugar, and cardamom powder.
Procedure: Mix ragi flour in water, cook until thick. Add jaggery, milk, and cardamom powder. Stir well and serve warm or chilled.

ingredients_list: Yogurt, water, green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, coriander, salt, and cumin powder.
Procedure: Blend yogurt and water. Add chopped chilies, ginger, salt, cumin, and coriander. Mix well, garnish with curry leaves, and serve chilled.

ingredients_list: Bread slices, onions, tomatoes, green chilies, mustard seeds, curry leaves, turmeric, and spices.
Procedure: oast bread and cut into pieces. Saute onions, tomatoes, and spices, add bread pieces, mix well, and cook until crispy. Serve hot.
